title: First Blog Update!
author: tinyplayerss
longDescription:
Ads help support me, the developer behind HyteServe, and allow the platform to stay updated with new content, tools, and features for the Hytale community.

If you use an ad blocker, I kindly ask that you consider whitelisting HyteServe. Ads are currently the main way I can keep the project alive and continue serving Hytale fans around the world with the content they’re looking for.

The ad network I’ve partnered with is Adsterra, which made it possible to set up fast, lightweight ads without disrupting your experience. If you’re not a fan of ads, no worries — I promise they will never block content or get in the way of browsing.

I would never allow ads that negatively impact the user experience.

title: Adsterra Security Patch: Solving Redirect Issues
author: tinyplayerss
description: We have implemented a patch to block malicious redirects from our ad provider.
longDescription:
Maintaining a safe and seamless experience on HyteServe is my top priority. Recently, I noticed that some Adsterra ads were causing unauthorized redirects, taking users away from our site to external pages. I have officially deployed a patch to address this.

The update includes stricter filtering on the ad scripts and the implementation of 'sandbox' attributes where possible to prevent the ads from triggering window-level redirects. This ensures that while ads still support the site, they can no longer hijack your browsing session.

If you still encounter any strange behavior or unexpected pop-ups, please reach out so I can continue to refine the security of our ad implementation.

title: New Hytale Update just Dropped! - Update 2
author: tinyplayerss
description: As far as i can Test my Current Mods still Works with Backwards Compatiblity
longDescription:
Hytale Update 2 is finally here, and as a solo developer keeping HyteServe alive, I’ve been diving deep into the patch notes to see how this affects our modding ecosystem. The big headline for me is WorldGen V2—the team has released public documentation for modders, which is a huge win for future custom biomes. I’ve already confirmed that my current mods are holding up well with backwards compatibility, but there's a lot to unpack under the hood.

Performance & Stability: The technical side got a major boost with a new server auto-update system and the UpdateModule core plugin. This makes managing server reboots and staged updates much cleaner. They’ve also overhauled shadow rendering and fixed those annoying weather transitions that used to feel a bit jarring. For those of us building, the Asset Editor now includes documentation directly in the tooltips—no more guessing what a specific node does!

System Improvements: The UI/UX changes are massive for quality of life. We finally have an official FPS counter overlay, and the inventory has been optimized with ‘Quick Action’ shortcuts (Q/E/R/T) for stacking and sorting. Combat also feels deeper with the introduction of Necromancy; you can now raise skeletal minions from bone piles, which adds a whole new layer to PvE progression. Oh, and for the farmers out there, ‘Eternal Crops’ no longer break from accidental weapon swings—a small fix that saves a lot of frustration.

I'll be monitoring the Mods I've got in the Mod library of HyteServe to ensure No mod would break on Hytale Update 2 Changes, And Report any Mods that dont work comment below to tell me about Mods not working so that i can ensure to make sure that Mod or Mods work as Expected!
